briefdescription.para: Initial state.
Delivery in progress.
Message successfully delivered and acknowledged by server.
Message was not delivered.
Message was received(and acknowledged) but cannot get file from server.
File transfer has been completed successfully.
Message successfully delivered and acknowledged to destination.
Message displayed to the remote user.
LinphoneChatMessageState is used to notify if messages have been succesfully delivered or not.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* LinphoneChatMessageStateChangedCb) (LinphoneChatMessage *msg, LinphoneChatMessageState state, void *ud)
memberdef.name: LinphoneChatMessageStateChangedCb

briefdescription.para: Call back used to notify message delivery status.
Call back used to notify message delivery status.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* LinphoneChatMessageCbsFileTransferRecvCb) (LinphoneChatMessage *message, const LinphoneContent *content, const LinphoneBuffer *buffer)
memberdef.name: LinphoneChatMessageCbsFileTransferRecvCb

briefdescription.para: File transfer receive callback prototype.

detaileddescription.para:
This function is called by the core upon an incoming File transfer is started. This function may be call several time for the same file in case of large file.
message
LinphoneChatMessage message from which the body is received.
content
LinphoneContent incoming content information
buffer
LinphoneBuffer holding the received data. Empty buffer means end of file.

memberdef.definition: typedef LinphoneBuffer*(* LinphoneChatMessageCbsFileTransferSendCb) (LinphoneChatMessage *message, const LinphoneContent *content, size_t offset, size_t size)
memberdef.argsstring: )(LinphoneChatMessage *message, const LinphoneContent *content, size_t offset, size_t size)
memberdef.name: LinphoneChatMessageCbsFileTransferSendCb

briefdescription.para: File transfer send callback prototype.

detaileddescription.para:
This function is called by the core when an outgoing file transfer is started. This function is called until size is set to 0.
message
LinphoneChatMessage message from which the body is received.
content
LinphoneContent outgoing content
offset
the offset in the file from where to get the data to be sent
size
the number of bytes expected by the framework
A LinphoneBuffer object holding the data written by the application. An empty buffer means end of file.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* LinphoneChatMessageCbsFileTransferProgressIndicationCb) (LinphoneChatMessage *message, const LinphoneContent *content, size_t offset, size_t total)
memberdef.argsstring: )(LinphoneChatMessage *message, const LinphoneContent *content, size_t offset, size_t total)
memberdef.name: LinphoneChatMessageCbsFileTransferProgressIndicationCb

briefdescription.para: File transfer progress indication callback prototype.

parameterdescription.para: LinphoneChatMessage message from which the body is received.
The number of bytes sent/received since the beginning of the transfer.
The total number of bytes to be sent/received.

briefdescription.para: A chat room message to hold content to be sent.

detaileddescription.para: Can be created by linphone_chat_room_create_message().

briefdescription.para: An object to handle the callbacks for the handling a LinphoneChatMessage objects.
LinphoneChatMessageState is used to notify if messages have been succesfully delivered or not.
A chat room is the place where text messages are exchanged.

detaileddescription.para: Can be created by linphone_core_create_chat_room().

briefdescription.para: Policy to use to send/receive instant messaging composing/delivery/display notifications.

detaileddescription.para: The sending of this information is done as in the RFCs 3994 (is_composing) and 5438 (imdn delivered/displayed).

briefdescription.para: Destroy a LinphoneChatRoom.
Create a message attached to a dedicated chat room;.

simplesect.para: a new LinphoneChatMessage

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneChatRoom *cr, const char *message, const char *external_body_url, LinphoneChatMessageState state, time_t time, bool_t is_read, bool_t is_incoming)

the time_t at which the message has been received/sent.

briefdescription.para: Create a message attached to a dedicated chat room with a particular content.

detaileddescription.para:
Use linphone_chat_room_send_message to initiate the transfer
cr
the chat room.
initial_content
LinphoneContent initial content. LinphoneCoreVTable.file_transfer_send is invoked later to notify file transfer progress and collect next chunk of the message if LinphoneContent.data is NULL.
a new LinphoneChatMessage

briefdescription.para: get peer address associated to this LinphoneChatRoom

simplesect.para: LinphoneAddress peer address

briefdescription.para: Send a message to peer member of this chat room.
Send a message to peer member of this chat room.

parameterdescription.para: LinphoneChatMessageStateChangeCb status callback invoked when message is delivered or could not be delivered. May be NULL
user data for the status cb.

simplesect.para: The LinphoneChatMessage must not be destroyed until the the callback is called. The LinphoneChatMessage reference is transfered to the function and thus doesn't need to be unref'd by the application.

briefdescription.para: Send a message to peer member of this chat room.

parameterdescription.para: LinphoneChatMessage object The state of the message sending will be notified via the callbacks defined in the LinphoneChatMessageCbs object that can be obtained by calling linphone_chat_message_get_callbacks(). The LinphoneChatMessage reference is transfered to the function and thus doesn't need to be unref'd by the application.

briefdescription.para: Mark all messages of the conversation as read.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneChatRoom object corresponding to the conversation.

briefdescription.para: Delete a message from the chat room history.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneChatRoom object corresponding to the conversation.

briefdescription.para: Delete all messages from the history.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneChatRoom object corresponding to the conversation.

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of messages in a chat room.

simplesect.para: the number of messages.

briefdescription.para: Gets nb_message most recent messages from cr chat room, sorted from oldest to most recent.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneChatRoom object corresponding to the conversation for which messages should be retrieved
Number of message to retrieve. 0 means everything.

simplesect.para: A list of LinphoneChatMessage objects. LinphoneChatMessage

briefdescription.para: Gets the partial list of messages in the given range, sorted from oldest to most recent.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneChatRoom object corresponding to the conversation for which messages should be retrieved
The first message of the range to be retrieved. History most recent message has index 0.
The last message of the range to be retrieved. History oldest message has index of history size - 1 (use linphone_chat_room_get_history_size to retrieve history size)

simplesect.para: A list of LinphoneChatMessage objects. LinphoneChatMessage

briefdescription.para: Notifies the destination of the chat message being composed that the user is typing a new message.

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of unread messages in the chatroom.

briefdescription.para: Returns back pointer to LinphoneCore object.

When realtime text is enabled linphone_call_params_realtime_text_enabled, LinphoneCoreIsComposingReceivedCb is call everytime a char is received from peer.

detaileddescription.para:
At the end of remote typing a regular LinphoneChatMessage is received with committed data from LinphoneCoreMessageReceivedCb.

The application might want to use it for keeping data over restarts, like thumbnail image path.

briefdescription.para: Get a chat room whose peer is the supplied address.

If it does not exist yet, it will be created. No reference is transfered to the application. The LinphoneCore keeps a reference on the chat room.

the linphone core

a linphone address.

briefdescription.para: Get a chat room for messaging from a sip uri like sip:joe@sip.linphone.org.

detaileddescription.para:
If it does not exist yet, it will be created. No reference is transfered to the application. The LinphoneCore keeps a reference on the chat room.
lc
A LinphoneCore object
to
The destination address for messages.
LinphoneChatRoom where messaging can take place.

briefdescription.para: Removes a chatroom including all message history from the LinphoneCore.
Inconditionnaly disable incoming chat messages.

briefdescription.para: Enable reception of incoming chat messages.

detaileddescription.para:
By default it is enabled but it can be disabled with linphone_core_disable_chat().

briefdescription.para: Chat room and Messaging.

detaileddescription.para: Exchanging text messages Messages are sent using LinphoneChatRoom object. First step is to create a chat room from a peer sip uri. LinphoneChatRoom*chat_room=linphone_core_get_chat_room(lc,"sip:joe@sip.linphone.org");
